2.heading: Ihara, Mai.
2.title: Rurouni Kenshin Profiles
2.author: translation, Kenichiro Yagi & Noritaka Minami & Mai Ihara ; design, Izumi Evers ; graphics, Forrest L
notes: (Shonen Jump Profiles)
Includes an interview with the author of Rurouni Kenshin, Nobuhiro Watsuki.

For the first time in English, get the facts about Nobuhiro Watsuki's Rurouni Kenshin. A popular manga, and, also, a hit anime series, it has a mix of historical detail, spectacular battles, and romantic comedy.

58.title: "Il a été payé pour être pris pour moi"
58.author: [No author]
58.series: La Fille du Proscrit) p. 6-9 in Le Journal de Nano et Nanette, no. 202
notes: "Résumé: Le père d'Amy Lyndon, faussement accusé d'être un bandit, avait dû s'enfuir de chez lui. Soupçonnée d'être sa complice, la jeune fille avait été confiée par le magistrat Sire Percy à sa tante Henriette et à sa cousine Charlotte qui la détestaient et voulaient s'approprier tous ses beins en la traitant comme leur servante. Apercevant dans la nuit un signal qui lui faisat son père, Amy devait absolument le rejoindre."
Plates numbered 41-44.
"A suivre."

117.title: "Une Île en Forme de Point d'Interrogation"
117.author: Jean-Pierre Mercier
117.appears_in: p. 22-27 in 9e Art : Les Cahiers du Musée de la Bande Dessinée, no. 8 (Jan. 2003).
notes: Begins: "Libre confrontation avec Jules Verne et chef-d'oeuvre d'onirisme paru in 1971, Mystérieuse Matin Midi et Soir mit un point final aux relations contrastées entre Jean-Claude Forest et la rédaction de l'hebdomadaire Vaillant."

English summary (from p. 150): "An Island Shaped Like a Question Mark. Published in 1971, Mystérieuse Matin Midi et Soir (Mysterious Morning, Afternoon and Evening) is a variation on Jules Verne's novel L'Ile Mystérieuse. At the time, the magazine Pif suspended its prepublication because of its 'excessive imaginativeness'! Jean-Pierre Mercier analyses the qualities of this narrative in which Barbarella in old age plays the part originally given to Captain Nemo."

215.title: I'll Pay $5,000 for a Swimsuit that Fits me!
215.author: by Cathy Guisewite.
notes: 1st ed.
Selected cartoons from Wake Me Up When I'm A Size 5, vol. 1. 1. Career girl comics. I. Guisewite, Cathy. II. Cathy. III. Wake Me Up When I'm A Size 5 ; v. 1 Call no.: PN6728.C37I4 1987

216.title: "I'll Pay You Two Bucks to Forget the Whole Thing"
216.author: Young & Gersher.
notes: For a dollar, Blondie wants Alexander to mow the lawn, take out the garbage, clean the garage, etc., and Alexander has a counter-offer.

217.title: "I'll Pitch it for Page One"
217.author: by June Brigman and Mary Schmich.
notes: Summary: The fire story is a heartbreaker, but Vanity Puffington thinks it's a waste of money to cover a story about poor people, and she's marrying the publisher.
Key word: Spending, front page.

219.title: "I'll Play the Blues for You"
219.author: by Joost Swarte
219.appears_in: p. 67-71 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 7 (Oct. 1980).

220.title: "I'll Play the Blues for You"
220.author: by Joost Swarte
220.appears_in: p. 67-71 in Heavy Metal, v. 4, no. 8 (Nov. 1980).

221.title: "I'll Play While I Ride and Count My Strokes"
221.author: by Frank King
221.appears_in: reproduced on p. 68 of Golf in the Comic Strips, ed. by Howard Ziehm (General Publishing Group, 1997).
notes: Summary: Doc lands his ball in the bed of a truck, and accepts a ride as he continues his cross country golf drive.

222.title: "Ill Power"
222.author: [No author]
222.series: Felix) 14 p. in Felix the Cat, no. 21

223.title: "I'll Put My Sewing Machine Here and My Desk Over There"
223.author: by Dick Moores
223.appears_in: p. 11 of The Menomonee Falls Guardian, no. 146 (Aug. 1976).
notes: Summary: Nina stares into Clovia's empty room.

224.heading: Ill Repute.
224.title: "The House of Ill Repute"
224.author: Ferbh
notes: By Fershid Bharucha, cf. Kennedy. Official Underground and Newave Comix Price Guide.

225.title: "I'll Say This Much For You, You Certainly Look Like a Player"
225.author: Mel Keefer, Jordan Lansky.
notes: Summary: Michelle Burns looks like she might be able to hit the golf ball, and she proves she can.

226.title: I'll See You in My Dreams, at Least
226.author: Mell Lazarus.
notes: A Momma collection. 1. Mothers
Comic books, strips, etc. I. Lazarus, Mell, 1927- II. Momma. Call no.: PN6728.M62I4 1981

227.heading: "I'll Send for You" 8 p. in Young Love, no. 108 (Feb./Mar.
227.author: [No author]

228.title: "I'll Send My Man Right Over"
228.author: by Greg Evans.
notes: Summary: TJ's Lawn Service has put out fliers with Brad's phone number on them.

229.title: "I'll Settle for the BLT"
229.author: Stahler.
notes: Summary: He tells the waitress he'd like a better candidate.

230.title: "I'll Shorten That to 'Team Player'"
230.author: Scott Adams.
notes: (Performance Review)
Summary: Alice improves morale by not beating her co-workers.

231.title: "I'll Show You a Guy with a Slippery Sandwich"
231.author: Hart.
notes: (Show Me)
Summary: About knowing on which side one's bread is buttered.

232.title: "I'll Start Reading Tomorrow"
232.author: Charles Schulz
232.appears_in: p. 5 in The Comics Journal, no. 205 (June 1998).
notes: (Blood & Thunder)
Two-panel response to The Comics Journal, no. 200, which included a Schulz interview and tributes.

233.title: "I'll Stir Up Some Vittles fer Me an' th' Boys"
233.author: Fred Lasswell.
233.series: Barney Google and Snuffy Smith, Mar. 9, 1988
notes: Summary: When Tater and Jughaid hear that Snuffy's going to cook, they decide to follow Loweezy to the church supper.

234.title: "I'll Stop at the Dentist's First"
234.author: by Merrill Blosser.
notes: Summary: Danny tells June he's getting his upper plate tightened, when really he's tricking her back to her old boy friend, Jim. Call no.: PN6726f.B55 "false teeth"

235.title: "I'll Take a Pink Flamingo, a Daffy Duck Whirligig, and that Silly Looking Broad in the Bloomers Bending Over"
235.author: by Johnny Hart.

236.title: "I'll Take My Vacation the First Rainy Week in September!"
236.author: [No author]
notes: Setting: Boss's desk.
Panel is signed with an "F" in a circle, plus "Wiwlym"?

237.title: "I'll Take the Biggest One You Have"
237.author: Walt Disney.
notes: Summary: Donald is selling brushes door-to-door, and the customer has a little boy that needs spanking.

238.title: "I'll Tell Louis You Called to Remind Him of the Poker Game Tonight, I Doubt if he'll be Free"
238.author: by Fred Neher.
notes: Setting: Stocks (restraints), smoking.

239.title: "I'll Throw In Another Nickel If You Go To The Hospital"
239.author: by Bill Watterson.
notes: Summary: Susie says she'll only pay 5 cents to see Calvin eat 5 worms.

240.heading: "I'll Throw It Again"* (Curious Avenue, July 2, 1993) / Toles.
notes: Summary: Rascal refuses to fetch the stick for just that reason.

241.title: "I'll Throw it in My Dustbin"
241.author: Smythe.
notes: Summary: Andy's burnt the bottom out of a pan, and Chalkie knows how to hide the fact from Flo.

242.title: I'll Throw the Book at You, Beetle Bailey
242.author: by Mort Walker.
notes: 1 v. : ill. ; 18 cm.
(Tempo Books) 1. Funny military comics. I. Walker, Mort. II. Beetle Bailey. Call no.: PN6728.B4I45 1973

243.title: "I'll Top That!"
243.author: [No author]
243.series: Atomic Bunny) 8 p. in Atomic Bunny, no. 13
notes: SUMMARY: Paul Bunyan and Atomic Bunny each take a turn trying to amuse Paul's son, Mortimer, with a giant spinning top.

244.title: "I'll Try To Make My Garbage More Palatable For You In The Future"
244.author: by Phil Dunlap.
notes: Summary: The week-old tuna sandwich stinks.

245.title: "I'll Use Real Slow Bullets"
245.author: [No author]
notes: Summary: Yosemite Sam is the fastest gun in the West, so he gives Bugs a handicap.

246.title: "I'll Wait Forever!"
246.author: illustrated by Jay Scott Pike
notes: Begins: "The moment had come at last, the one second in eternity that every girl waits for, the time when the man I loved took me in his arms and asked me to marry him!"

247.title: "I'll Wait Just a Few Minutes, and Then Scope Out the Situation"
247.author: Dick Locher, Max Collins.
notes: Summary: Riding behind a van on a skateboard means you're close to the turn signals.

248.heading: I'll Wait Outside Your Room--Reviews.
248.title: "Comics Freely Offered
248.author: by Tom Spurgeon
248.appears_in: p. 59-61 in The Comics Journal, no. 249 (Dec. 2002).
notes: Reviews of: I'll Wait Outside Your Room, and The Monster that Ate Stars (both by Sother Salazar) ; Keeping Two, and The Shortcut (both by Jordan Crane) ; The Motherless One (Gene Luen Yang) ; Nothingness : Big Questions #5 (Anders Brekhus Nisen) ; and Ramsden ; Though I Slumber, My Heart is Still Awake ; and Torah Teaches that the World was Created with as Much Effort as it Takes You to Pronounce the Sound of an H (all three by Sammy Harkham).

249.heading: I'll Wait Outside Your Room--Reviews.
249.title: "He Lives : The 2002 Minimalism Cartoonist of the Year"
249.author: by Tom Spurgeon
249.appears_in: p. 63-66 in The Comics Journal, no. 250 (Feb. 2003).
notes: (2002, the Year in Review)

Review of: It Lives (Ted May) ; includes a "Selected Ted May Bibliography" and brief review-recommendations of Artichoke Tales #3 (Megan Kelso) ; I'll Wait Outside Your Room (Souther Salazar) ; Ironclad (Dan Zettowch) ; and Paper Rodeo.

250.heading: Ill Winds.

250.author: [No author]
